body_html:
If you want to run the tensorflow-gpu docker image, you have to use nvidia-docker.
Unfortunately, the way the library is built right now, when TF starts running, it will try to load GPU libraries, and on non-gpu machines I am guessing this is failing.

I am not aware if our gpu docker images ever worked without nvidia-docker, could you point me to a version that you can get working? If it used to work, maybe we can get it to work the same way. But I cannot promise anything.

body:
If you want to run the tensorflow-gpu docker image, you have to use nvidia-docker.
Unfortunately, the way the library is built right now, when TF starts running, it will try to load GPU libraries, and on non-gpu machines I am guessing this is failing.

I am not aware if our gpu docker images ever worked without nvidia-docker, could you point me to a version that you can get working? If it used to work, maybe we can get it to work the same way. But I cannot promise anything.
